<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Grim Ring](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1538)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 19

**Price** 150 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This golden ring is sculpted with the visage of a grinning skull on the side. While wearing the ring, you can attempt to detect the presence of [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creatures as an [exploration](/Traits.aspx?ID=66) activity. This reveals the presence or absence of undead in the area, but it doesn't pinpoint their locations. This ring can't detect undead whose appearance is masked by any [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) spell that is 2nd level or higher. If an undead is hiding or disguised, the GM rolls a secret Perception check for you against the undead's [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) or [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) DC, as appropriate, with a +2 item bonus to your check.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision ([positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128)) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You gain the [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) condition from an undead creature;  **Effect** Reduce the value of the drained condition you gain by 1, and the undead that caused the condition takes 2d6 positive damage.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Grim Ring
